column4: would anyone be willing to help me figure out how to get my line printer working with lucid server?
i can't think of anything else
my usb > parallel adapter shows up in lsusb
lsmod shows everything i think should have loaded
yet there's no device
nobody likes line printers? :(
I love line printers
what is the lucid server, how does it not work, and what are you trying to do that provokes the failure?
we're talking about the dinosour type oki 380 that takes  paper with holes on both sides of fed paper here?
you should, and in which case, you should be able to do    echo "lol" > /dev/lp0
cups will ruin your life in this case.
be afraid.  however;  if your BIOS is standard-y, the /dev/lp* should have have an entry that gives you direct access to it
what does ls /dev/lp* say?
that is unfortunate.  there is not even an entry, with an unresolved link, to /dev/lp0?
i have a usb to parallel converter for it, so i was thinking that it was causeing the problem
I don't think Ubuntu is the distribution you would like to choose as your starting point then. I imagine any/all other distros heed that ancient protocol.
oh, certainly, that changes things :p
which is the pertinent line from lsmod?
if i lsmod | grep ls i get . . .
nothing unusual
what's the usual, in the context of unplugging and replugging your printer?
huh.  is this a laptop?
nope, i moved and lost the old cable
depending on your time/money schedule, maybe you want to look into a motherboard that has a centronics style parallel port output.  they're starting at around 15 dollars.
